content:
The city museum and art gallery are both great attractions in the downtown area. Here are some healthy lunch options near those landmarks:

**Near the City Museum:**

1. The Daily Grind: A casual cafe serving salads, sandwiches, and soups. They have a variety of healthy options, including vegan and gluten-free choices. (5-minute walk from the city museum)
2. The Green Scene: A salad bar with a wide range of ingredients and protein options. They also offer wraps and bowls. (7-minute walk from the city museum)
3. Bistro 123: A modern bistro serving seasonal small plates, salads, and sandwiches. They source their ingredients from local farms and offer healthy options. (10-minute walk from the city museum)

**Near the Art Gallery:**

1. Freshii: A healthy fast food chain offering salads, wraps, and bowls with a variety of vegetarian and vegan options. (3-minute walk from the art gallery)
2. The Good Earth: A cafe serving healthy breakfast and lunch options, including omelets, salads, and sandwiches. They use locally sourced ingredients and offer gluten-free options. (5-minute walk from the art gallery)
3. The Kitchen: A farm-to-table restaurant with a focus on seasonal ingredients. They offer healthy lunch options, including salads, sandwiches, and bowls. (10-minute walk from the art gallery)

These options should give you a good starting point. Enjoy your visit to the city museum and art gallery, and I hope you find a healthy and delicious lunch spot that suits your taste!
